alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:19AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clark, Pike, southwestern Garland, southern Montgomery and west central Hot Spring Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 919 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norman to near Albert Pike Recreation Area to Umpire. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro... Mount Ida... Glenwood... Amity... Norman... Daisy... Mimosa... Daisy State Park... Narrows Dam... Meyers... Lofton... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Black Springs... Alpine... Bonnerdale... Lodi... Langley... Nathan... Point Cedar... Fancyhill... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
